00045 /* Private macro -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 /** @defgroup GPIO_Private_Macro GPIO private macros
00047   * @{
00048   */
00049 #if (AUTO_CK_CONTROL == 1)
00050   #define GPIO_CK_ST       u32 isAlreadyOn
00051   #define GPIO_CK_ON()     (isAlreadyOn = _GPIO_ClockControl(HT_GPIOx, ENABLE))
00052   #define GPIO_CK_OFF()    if (isAlreadyOn == FALSE) _GPIO_ClockControl(HT_GPIOx, DISABLE)
00053   #define AFIO_CK_ST       u32 isAlreadyOn
00054   #define AFIO_CK_ON()     (isAlreadyOn = _AFIO_ClockControl(ENABLE))
00055   #define AFIO_CK_OFF()    if (isAlreadyOn == FALSE) _AFIO_ClockControl(DISABLE)
00056 #else
00057   #define GPIO_CK_ST
00058   #define GPIO_CK_ON(...)
00059   #define GPIO_CK_OFF(...)
00060   #define AFIO_CK_ST
00061   #define AFIO_CK_ON(...)
00062   #define AFIO_CK_OFF(...)
00063 #endif
00064 /**
00065   * @}
00066   */

00072 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00073  * @brief Deinitializes the GPIO peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00074  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00075  * @retval None
00076  ************************************************************************************************************/
00077 void GPIO_DeInit(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx)
00078 {
00079   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00080 
00081   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00082   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00083 
00084   if (HT_GPIOx == HT_GPIOA)
00085   {
00086     RSTCUReset.Bit.PA = 1;
00087   }
00088   else if (HT_GPIOx == HT_GPIOB)
00089   {
00090     RSTCUReset.Bit.PB = 1;
00091   }
00092   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOC)
00093   else if (HT_GPIOx == HT_GPIOC)
00094   {
00095     RSTCUReset.Bit.PC = 1;
00096   }
00097   #endif
00098   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOD)
00099   else if (HT_GPIOx == HT_GPIOD)
00100   {
00101     RSTCUReset.Bit.PD = 1;
00102   }
00103   #endif
00104   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOE)
00105   else if (HT_GPIOx == HT_GPIOE)
00106   {
00107     RSTCUReset.Bit.PE = 1;
00108   }
00109   #endif
00110   #if (LIBCFG_GPIOF)
00111   else if (HT_GPIOx == HT_GPIOF)
00112   {
00113     RSTCUReset.Bit.PF = 1;
00114   }
00115   #endif
00116 
00117   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00118 }

00120 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00121  * @brief Configure the direction of specified GPIO pins.
00122  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00123  * @param GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP: The port pins.
00124  *   This parameter can be any combination of GPIO_PIN_x.
00125  * @param GPIO_DIR_INorOUT:
00126  *   This parameter can be one of below:
00127  *     @arg GPIO_DIR_IN  : The pins are input mode
00128  *     @arg GPIO_DIR_OUT : The pins are output mode
00129  * @retval None
00130  ************************************************************************************************************/
00131 void GPIO_DirectionConfig(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP, GPIO_DIR_Enum GPIO_DIR_INorOUT)
00132 {
00133   GPIO_CK_ST;
00134 
00135   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00136   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00137   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO_DIR(GPIO_DIR_INorOUT));
00138 
00139   GPIO_CK_ON();
00140 
00141   if (GPIO_DIR_INorOUT != GPIO_DIR_IN)
00142     HT_GPIOx->DIRCR |= GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00143   else
00144     HT_GPIOx->DIRCR &= ~GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00145 
00146   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00147 }
00148 
00149 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00150  * @brief Configure the pull resistor of specified GPIO pins.
00151  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00152  * @param GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP: The port pins.
00153  *   This parameter can be any combination of GPIO_PIN_x.
00154  * @param GPIO_PR_x: Selection of Pull resistor.
00155  *   This parameter can be one of below:
00156  *     @arg GPIO_PR_UP      : The pins with internal pull-up resistor
00157  *     @arg GPIO_PR_DOWN    : The pins with internal pull-down resistor
00158  *     @arg GPIO_PR_DISABLE : The pins without pull resistor
00159  * @retval None
00160  ************************************************************************************************************/
00161 void GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP, GPIO_PR_Enum GPIO_PR_x)
00162 {
00163   u32 temp_up, temp_down;
00164   GPIO_CK_ST;
00165 
00166   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00167   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00168   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO_PR(GPIO_PR_x));
00169 
00170   GPIO_CK_ON();
00171   temp_up = HT_GPIOx->PUR;
00172   temp_down = HT_GPIOx->PDR;
00173 
00174   #if (LIBCFG_GPIO_PR_STRONG_UP)
00175   temp_up   &= ~(GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP << 16);
00176   #endif
00177   temp_up   &= ~GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00178   temp_down &= ~GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00179 
00180   switch (GPIO_PR_x)
00181   {
00182     case GPIO_PR_UP:
00183       temp_up   |= GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00184       break;
00185     case GPIO_PR_DOWN:
00186       temp_down |= GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00187       break;
00188     case GPIO_PR_DISABLE:
00189       break;
00190     #if (LIBCFG_GPIO_PR_STRONG_UP)
00191     case GPIO_PR_STRONG_UP:
00192       temp_up   |= (GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP << 16);
00193       break;
00194     case GPIO_PR_STRONGEST_UP:
00195       temp_up   |= (GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP << 16);
00196       temp_up   |= GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00197       break;
00198     #endif
00199     default:
00200       break;
00201   }
00202 
00203   HT_GPIOx->PUR = temp_up;
00204   HT_GPIOx->PDR = temp_down;
00205 
00206   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00207 }
00208 
00209 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00210  * @brief Enable or Disable the input control of specified GPIO pins.
00211  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00212  * @param GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP: The port pins.
00213  *   This parameter can be any combination of GPIO_PIN_x.
00214  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00215  * @retval None
00216  ************************************************************************************************************/
00217 void GPIO_InputConfig(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP, ControlStatus Cmd)
00218 {
00219   GPIO_CK_ST;
00220 
00221   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00222   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00223   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00224 
00225   GPIO_CK_ON();
00226   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00227     HT_GPIOx->INER |= GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00228   else
00229     HT_GPIOx->INER &= ~GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00230   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00231 }
00232 
00233 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00234  * @brief Select the driving current of specified GPIO pins.
00235  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00236  * @param GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP: The port pins.
00237  *   This parameter can be any combination of GPIO_PIN_x.
00238  * @param GPIO_DV_nMA:
00239  *   This parameter can be one of below:
00240  *     @arg GPIO_DV_4MA  : Select output driving current as  4 mA
00241  *     @arg GPIO_DV_8MA  : Select output driving current as  8 mA
00242  *     @arg GPIO_DV_12MA : Select output driving current as 12 mA
00243  *     @arg GPIO_DV_16MA : Select output driving current as 16 mA
00244  * @retval None
00245  ************************************************************************************************************/
00246 void GPIO_DriveConfig(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP, GPIO_DV_Enum GPIO_DV_nMA)
00247 {
00248   u32 index, temp, CurrentMode = 0, PinPosition = 0;
00249   GPIO_CK_ST;
00250 
00251   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00252   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00253   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO_DV(GPIO_DV_nMA));
00254 
00255   for (index = 0; index < 16; index++)
00256   {
00257     if ((GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP & 0x0001) == 1)
00258     {
00259       temp = index << 1;
00260       CurrentMode |= ((u32) GPIO_DV_nMA << temp);
00261       PinPosition |= ((u32) 0x03  << temp);
00262     }
00263     GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP >>= 1;
00264   }
00265 
00266   GPIO_CK_ON();
00267   HT_GPIOx->DRVR &= ~PinPosition;
00268   HT_GPIOx->DRVR |= CurrentMode;
00269   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00270 }
00271 
00272 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00273  * @brief Enable or Disable the open drain function of specified GPIO pins.
00274  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00275  * @param GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP: The port pins.
00276  *   This parameter can be any combination of GPIO_PIN_x.
00277  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00278  * @retval None
00279  ************************************************************************************************************/
00280 void GPIO_OpenDrainConfig(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP, ControlStatus Cmd)
00281 {
00282   GPIO_CK_ST;
00283 
00284   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00285   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00286   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00287 
00288   GPIO_CK_ON();
00289   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00290     HT_GPIOx->ODR |= GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00291   else
00292     HT_GPIOx->ODR &= ~GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00293   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00294 }

00300  * @param GPIO_PIN_n: The port pins.

00306 {
00307   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00308   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00309   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(Cmd));
00310 
00311   if (Cmd != DISABLE)
00312     HT_GPIOx->SCER |= GPIO_PIN_n;
00313   else
00314     HT_GPIOx->SCER &= ~GPIO_PIN_n;
00315 }

00318 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00319  * @brief Get the input data of specified port pin.
00320  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00321  * @param GPIO_PIN_n: This parameter can be GPIO_PIN_x.
00322  * @retval SET or RESET
00323  ************************************************************************************************************/
00324 FlagStatus GPIO_ReadInBit(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_n)
00325 {
00326   FlagStatus result;
00327   GPIO_CK_ST;
00328 
00329   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00330   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00331 
00332   GPIO_CK_ON();
00333   if ((HT_GPIOx->DINR & GPIO_PIN_n) != RESET)
00334     result = SET;
00335   else
00336     result = RESET;
00337 
00338   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00339   return result;
00340 }
00341 
00342 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00343  * @brief Get the input data of specified GPIO port.
00344  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00345  * @retval The value of input data register.
00346  ************************************************************************************************************/
00347 u16 GPIO_ReadInData(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx)
00348 {
00349   u16 uValue;
00350   GPIO_CK_ST;
00351 
00352   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00353   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00354 
00355   GPIO_CK_ON();
00356   uValue = (u16)HT_GPIOx->DINR;
00357   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00358   return (uValue);
00359 }

00403 /*********************************************************************************************************//**

00409  ************************************************************************************************************/
00410 void GPIO_SetOutBits(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP)
00411 {

00413 
00414   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00415   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00416 
00417   GPIO_CK_ON();
00418   HT_GPIOx->SRR = GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00419   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00420 }

00441 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00442  * @brief Set or Clear the selected port bits of data.
00443  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00444  * @param GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP: Specify the port bits.
00445  *   This parameter can be any combination of GPIO_PIN_x.
00446  * @param Status: This parameter can be SET or RESET.
00447  * @retval None
00448  ************************************************************************************************************/
00449 void GPIO_WriteOutBits(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP, FlagStatus Status)
00450 {
00451   GPIO_CK_ST;
00452 
00453   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00454   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00455 
00456   GPIO_CK_ON();
00457   if (Status != RESET)
00458     HT_GPIOx->SRR = GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00459   else
00460     HT_GPIOx->RR = GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00461   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00462 }

00482 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00483  * @brief Lock configuration of GPIO pins.
00484  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00485  * @param GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP: Specify the port bits.
00486  *   This parameter can be any combination of GPIO_PIN_x.
00487  * @retval None
00488  ************************************************************************************************************/
00489 void GPIO_PinLock(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP)
00490 {
00491   GPIO_CK_ST;
00492 
00493   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00494   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00495 
00496   GPIO_CK_ON();
00497   HT_GPIOx->LOCKR = (u32)0x5FA00000 | GPIO_PIN_nBITMAP;
00498   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00499 }
00500 
00501 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00502  * @brief Get the lock state of specified GPIO port.
00503  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00504  * @retval TRUE or FALSE
00505  ************************************************************************************************************/
00506 bool GPIO_IsPortLocked(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx)
00507 {
00508   bool result;
00509   GPIO_CK_ST;
00510 
00511   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00512   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00513 
00514   GPIO_CK_ON();
00515   if ((HT_GPIOx->LOCKR >> 16) == 0)
00516     result = FALSE;
00517   else
00518     result = TRUE;
00519   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00520   return result;
00521 }
00522 
00523 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00524  * @brief Get the lock state of specified GPIO port pin.
00525  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00526  * @param GPIO_PIN_n: This parameter can be GPIO_PIN_x.
00527  * @retval TRUE or FALSE
00528  ************************************************************************************************************/
00529 bool GPIO_IsPinLocked(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, u16 GPIO_PIN_n)
00530 {
00531   bool result;
00532   GPIO_CK_ST;
00533 
00534   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00535   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO(HT_GPIOx));
00536 
00537   GPIO_CK_ON();
00538   if ((HT_GPIOx->LOCKR & GPIO_PIN_n) == 0)
00539     result = FALSE;
00540   else
00541     result = TRUE;
00542   GPIO_CK_OFF();
00543   return result;
00544 }

00546 #if (LIBCFG_GPIO_DISABLE_DEBUG_PORT)
00547 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00548  * @brief  Disable DEBUG port to prevent unexpected security lock.
00549  * @retval None
00550  ************************************************************************************************************/
00551 void GPIO_DisableDebugPort(void)
00552 {
00553   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{ 0 }};
00554   CKCUClock.Bit.PA         = 1;
00555   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO       = 1;
00556   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00557 
00558   AFIO_GPxConfig(GPIO_PA, GPIO_PIN_13, AFIO_FUN_GPIO);
00559   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_13, GPIO_PR_DOWN);
00560 
00561   #if defined(USE_HT32F52342_52)
00562   GPIO_InputConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_13, DISABLE);
00563   #endif
00564 
00565   #if 0
00566   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_DOWN);
00567   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_UP);
00568   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_DOWN);
00569   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_UP);
00570   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_DOWN);
00571   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_UP);
00572   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_DOWN);
00573   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HT_GPIOA, GPIO_PIN_12, GPIO_PR_UP);
00574   AFIO_GPxConfig(GPIO_PA, GPIO_PIN_12, AFIO_FUN_GPIO);
00575   #endif
00576 }
00577 #endif

00579 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00580  * @brief Convert HT_GPIOx to GPIO_Px
00581  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00582  * @retval GPIO_Px: GPIO ID
00583  ************************************************************************************************************/
00584 u32 GPIO_GetID(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx)
00585 {
00586   // Convert 0x400B0000 ~ 0x400C6000 to 0 ~ 11
00587   u32 GPIO_Px = (((u32)HT_GPIOx) >> (12 + 1)) & 0x7F;
00588   GPIO_Px -= 0x58;  // 0xB0000 >> 13 = 0x58
00589 
00590   return GPIO_Px;
00591 }
00592 
00593 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00594  * @brief Deinitialize the AFIO peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00595  * @retval None
00596  ************************************************************************************************************/
00597 void AFIO_DeInit(void)
00598 {
00599   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00600 
00601   RSTCUReset.Bit.AFIO = 1;
00602   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00603 }
00604 
00605 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00606  * @brief Configure alternated mode of GPIO with specified pins.
00607  * @param GPIO_Px: GPIO_PA ~ GPIO_PD.
00608  * @param AFIO_PIN_n: This parameter can be any combination of AFIO_PIN_x.
00609  * @param AFIO_MODE_n: This parameter can be one of the following values:
00610  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_DEFAULT : The default I/O function
00611  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_1       : Alternated mode 1
00612  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_2       : Alternated mode 2
00613  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_3       : Alternated mode 3
00614  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_4       : Alternated mode 4
00615  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_5       : Alternated mode 5
00616  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_6       : Alternated mode 6
00617  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_7       : Alternated mode 7
00618  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_8       : Alternated mode 8
00619  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_9       : Alternated mode 9
00620  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_10      : Alternated mode 10
00621  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_11      : Alternated mode 11
00622  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_12      : Alternated mode 12
00623  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_13      : Alternated mode 13
00624  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_14      : Alternated mode 14
00625  *        @arg AFIO_MODE_15      : Alternated mode 15
00626  * @retval None
00627  ************************************************************************************************************/
00628 void AFIO_GPxConfig(u32 GPIO_Px, u32 AFIO_PIN_n, AFIO_MODE_Enum AFIO_MODE_n)
00629 {
00630   vu32* pGPxCFGR = ((vu32*)&HT_AFIO->GPACFGR[0]) + GPIO_Px * 2;
00631   u32 index = 0;
00632   u32 Mask = 0, PinMode = 0;
00633   s32 i;
00634   AFIO_CK_ST;
00635 
00636   Assert_Param(IS_AFIO_MODE(AFIO_MODE_n));
00637   AFIO_CK_ON();
00638 
00639   for (i = 0; i <= 8; i += 8)
00640   {
00641     Mask = 0;
00642     PinMode = 0;
00643     if (AFIO_PIN_n & (0x00FF << i))
00644     {
00645       for (index = 0; index < 8; index++)
00646       {
00647         if ((AFIO_PIN_n >> index) & (0x0001 << i))
00648         {
00649           Mask |= (0xF << (index * 4));
00650           PinMode |= (AFIO_MODE_n << (index * 4));
00651         }
00652       }
00653       *pGPxCFGR = (*pGPxCFGR & (~Mask)) | PinMode;
00654     }
00655     pGPxCFGR++;
00656   }
00657 
00658   AFIO_CK_OFF();
00659 }
00660 
00661 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00662  * @brief Select the GPIO pin to be used as EXTI channel.
00663  * @param GPIO_PIN_NUM_n: Specify the GPIO pin number to be configured.
00664  * @param GPIO_Px: GPIO_PA ~ GPIO_PF.
00665  * @retval None
00666  ************************************************************************************************************/
00667 void AFIO_EXTISourceConfig(u32 GPIO_PIN_NUM_n, u32 GPIO_Px)
00668 {
00669   u8 index = 0;
00670   u32 tmp = 0;
00671   AFIO_CK_ST;
00672 
00673   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00674   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO_PORT(GPIO_Px));
00675   Assert_Param(IS_GPIO_PIN_NUM(GPIO_PIN_NUM_n));
00676 
00677   AFIO_CK_ON();
00678 
00679   if (GPIO_PIN_NUM_n > 7)
00680   {
00681     #if (LIBCFG_EXTI_8CH)
00682     GPIO_Px += 8;
00683     #else
00684     index = 1;
00685     #endif
00686     GPIO_PIN_NUM_n -= 8;
00687   }
00688 
00689   tmp = HT_AFIO->ESSR[index];
00690   tmp &= ~((u32)0x0F << (GPIO_PIN_NUM_n * 4));
00691   tmp |= (u32)GPIO_Px << (GPIO_PIN_NUM_n * 4);
00692   HT_AFIO->ESSR[index] = tmp;
00693   AFIO_CK_OFF();
00694 }
00695 /**
00696   * @}
00697   */
00698 
00699 /* Private functions ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00700 /** @defgroup GPIO_Private_Functions GPIO private functions
00701   * @{
00702   */
00703 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00704  * @brief Turn on/Turn off specify GPIO clock.
00705  * @param HT_GPIOx: where HT_GPIOx is the selected GPIO from the GPIO peripherals.
00706  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00707  * @retval TRUE or FALSE (TRUE: already turn on, FALSE, Turn on by this call)
00708  ***********************************************************************************************************/
00709 u32 _GPIO_ClockControl(HT_GPIO_TypeDef* HT_GPIOx, ControlStatus Cmd)
00710 {
00711   u32 PxENStatus;
00712   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00713   /* ((0x400Bx000 & 0x0000F000) >> 12 ) / 2 + 16 =                                                          */
00714   /*  (0x0 ~ 0x4) + 16 = 16 ~ 20 for AHBCCR PAEN ~ PEEN bit offset                                          */
00715   /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00716   u32 offset = ((((u32)HT_GPIOx) & 0x0000F000) >> 12) / 2 + 16;
00717 
00718   PxENStatus = HT_CKCU->AHBCCR & (1 << offset);
00719 
00720   if (PxENStatus != 0)
00721   {
00722     if (Cmd == DISABLE)
00723     {
00724       HT_CKCU->AHBCCR &= (~(1 << offset));
00725     }
00726     return TRUE;
00727   }
00728 
00729   HT_CKCU->AHBCCR |= (1 << offset);
00730   return FALSE;
00731 }
00732 
00733 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00734  * @brief Turn on/Turn off AFIO clock.
00735  * @param Cmd: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00736  * @retval TRUE or FALSE (TRUE: already turn on, FALSE, Turn on by this call)
00737  ***********************************************************************************************************/
00738 u32 _AFIO_ClockControl(ControlStatus Cmd)
00739 {
00740   u32 AFIOENStatus;
00741 
00742   AFIOENStatus = HT_CKCU->APBCCR0 & (1 << 14);
00743 
00744   if (AFIOENStatus != 0)
00745   {
00746     if (Cmd == DISABLE)
00747     {
00748       HT_CKCU->APBCCR0 &= (~(1 << 14));
00749     }
00750     return TRUE;
00751   }
00752 
00753   HT_CKCU->APBCCR0 |= (1 << 14);
00754   return FALSE;
00755 }
00756 /**
00757   * @}
00758   */
00759 
00760 
00761 /**
00762   * @}
00763   */
00764 
00765 /**
00766   * @}
00767   */
